author: David Harrison
title: Two More Rate Increases This Year, Flatter Path In 2019, 2020, Fed’s Kaplan Says
text:
Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Robert Kaplan said he sees the Fed raising interest rates twice more this year but added the pace of rate increases could ease in future years because of slowing growth.
“2018 will be a relatively solid year for GDP growth,” Mr. Kaplan said in a Bloomberg TV interview from Beijing. “In [2019] and 2020 I think you’ll see growth moderating and so for me the path of rate increases is likely a little bit flatter.”
...
